abstract: Sec of State John Kerry faces unexpected challenge as deadline approaches in negotiations on pending nuclear program accord with Iran; five former members of Pres Obama's inner circle of Iran advisers post open letter, sent to White House and State Dept, questioning current agreement and expressing concerns that it falls short of administration's own standards for strong and viable deal.
lead_paragraph: In a letter, five former members of President Obama’s circle of Iran advisers said a pending accord to stem Iran’s nuclear program might “fall short” of administration standards.

headline.main: Ex-Advisers Warn Obama That Iran Nuclear Deal ‘May Fall Short’ of Standards
headline.print_headline: Ex-Advisers Warn Obama That Iran Deal ‘May Fall Short’ of Standards

snippet: In a letter, five former members of President Obama’s circle of Iran advisers said a pending accord to stem Iran’s nuclear program might “fall short” of administration standards.
